page.title: 12RELIGION
page.content: The Buchanites settled in this area in 1784, with their founder Mrs Buchan from Irvine. In "Buchan Ha" they lived according to their extraordinary religious beliefs. They didn't accept marriage; the few children in the community were considered common property and so were given to foster parents, and they believed they would go directly to heaven avoiding death. There was only one dormitory with very close beds which led to no privacy and promiscuity. To outside observers there appeared to be no natural increase within the Buchanites. Believing that infants had no souls many were drowned at birth. Work was done not for wages but for food to feed their community. The Buchanites were driven out of the district and eventually settled in Crocketford.
